sen.j: 奈良原 繁（ならはら しげる、天保5年5月23日 (旧暦)（1834年6月29日） - 大正7年（1918年）8月13日）は、日本の武士、官僚である。
sen.e: Shigeru NARAHARA (June 29, 1834 - August 13, 1918) was samurai and a government official in Japan.
Shigeru NARAHARA (June 29, 1834 - August 13, 1918) was samurai and a government official in Japan.
Shigeru NARAHARA (June 29, 1834 - August 13, 1918) was samurai and a government official in Japan.

sen.j: 静岡県令、沖縄県知事（第4代）、貴族院 (日本)議員、元老院議官、錦鶏間祗候、日本鉄道会社、（のち甲武鉄道会社、両毛鉄道会社水戸鉄道社長兼任）の社長など。
sen.e: He held various posts such as the Shizuoka prefectural governor, the (fourth) governor of Okinawa, a member of the House of Peers (of Japan), Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders), Kinkei-no-ma shiko (Kinkei Hall attendance) and the president of Nippon Railway (later serving concurrently as the president of Kobu Railway Company, Ryomo Railway Company, and Mito Railway Co.).
sen.cmt: 甲武鉄道会社<http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=otgWLARRc5cC&pg=PA222&lpg=PA222&dq=%22Kobu+Railway+Company%22&source=bl&ots=DfUYkLZr94&sig=H2MVYNQv0w7bESmNub9uS_Oay2o&hl=ja&ei=kME7TI2PCoHCcZ338PwO&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CBgQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22Kobu%20Railway%20Company%22&f=false>両毛鉄道会社<http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/40015905089>水戸鉄道<http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110000314400>
sen.e: He held various posts such as the Shizuoka prefectural governor, the (fourth) governor of Okinawa, a member of the House of Peers (of Japan), Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders), Kinkei-no-ma shiko (Kinkei Hall attendance) and the president of Nippon Railway (later serving concurrently as the president of Kobu Railway Company, Ryomo Railway Company, and Mito Railway Co.).

He held various posts such as the Shizuoka prefectural governor, the (fourth) governor of Okinawa, a member of the House of Peers (of Japan), Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders), Kinkei-no-ma shiko (Kinkei Hall attendance) and the president of Nippon Railway (later serving concurrently as the president of Kobu Railway Company, Ryomo Railway Company, and Mito Railway Co.).

sen.j: 男爵。
sen.e: He was a baron.
He was a baron.
He was a baron.

sen.j: 薩摩藩出身。
sen.e: He was from Satsuma Domain.
He was from Satsuma Domain.
He was from Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 諱は混。
sen.e: Imina (personal name) was Kon (混).
His Imina (personal name) was Kon (混).
His Imina (personal name) was Kon (混).

sen.j: 幼名は三次。
sen.e: His childhood name was Sanji.
His childhood name was Sanji.
His childhood name was Sanji.

sen.j: 通称喜八郎。
sen.e: He was commonly called Kihachiro.
He was commonly called Kihachiro.
He was commonly called Kihachiro.

sen.j: 名乗りは幸五郎だが、明治7年（1874年）の島津家家令あたりから繁と改める。
sen.e: He was called Yukigoro after reaching adulthood, but he changed it to Shigeru around the time when he served as a butler for the Shimazu family in 1874.
He was called Yukigoro after reaching adulthood, but he changed it to Shigeru around the time when he served as a butler for the Shimazu family in 1874.
He was called Yukigoro after reaching adulthood, but he changed it to Shigeru around the time when he served as a butler for the Shimazu family in 1874.

sen.j: 兄・喜左衛門は、熱心な薬丸自顕流の門弟であるが、弟のほうは鎗の使い手として知られた。
sen.e: His older brother, Kizaemon was a devout disciple of Yakumarujigen-ryu school and the younger brother was known as a spearman.
His older brother, Kizaemon was a devout disciple of Yakumarujigen-ryu school and the younger brother was known as a spearman.
His older brother, Kizaemon was a devout disciple of Yakumarujigen-ryu school and the younger brother was known as a spearman.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）の島津久光の卒兵上京に従い、寺田屋事件では鎮撫使の一人として活躍。
sen.e: When Hisamitsu SHIMAZU's soldiers went up to Kyoto in 1862, Shigeru played an active role in the Teradaya Incident as one of Chinbushi (temporary government post involving security enforcement).
sen.cmt: 「鎮撫使」の英訳は<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%8E%AE%E6%92%AB>を参考にしました。
sen.e: When Hisamitsu SHIMAZU's soldiers went up to Kyoto in 1862, Shigeru played an active role in the Teradaya Incident as one of Chinbushi (temporary government post involving security enforcement).
When Hisamitsu SHIMAZU's soldiers went up to Kyoto in 1862, Shigeru played an active role in the Teradaya Incident as one of Chinbushi (temporary government post involving security enforcement).

sen.j: その年の生麦事件では、リチャードソンに斬りつけたのは、兄の喜左衛門ではなく、弟の繁であると子孫から異議が申したてられている。
sen.e: A descendant of Kizaemon protested against the Namamugi Incident happened during the year, saying that it was the younger brother, Shigeru, not his older brother, Kizaemon who slashed Richardson.
A descendant of Kizaemon protested against the Namamugi Incident happened during the year, saying that it was the younger brother, Shigeru, not his older brother, Kizaemon who slashed Richardson.
A descendant of Kizaemon protested against the Namamugi Incident happened during the year, saying that it was the younger brother, Shigeru, not his older brother, Kizaemon who slashed Richardson.

sen.j: 翌年の八月十八日の政変では、高崎正風らと暗躍し、京から長州藩追放に成功している。
sen.e: In the Coup of August 18 in the following year, he worked behind the scenes with Masakaze TAKASAKI and succeeded in driving Choshu Domain out of Kyoto.
In the Coup of August 18 in the following year, he worked behind the scenes with Masakaze TAKASAKI and succeeded in driving Choshu Domain out of Kyoto.
In the Coup of August 18 in the following year, he worked behind the scenes with Masakaze TAKASAKI and succeeded in driving Choshu Domain out of Kyoto.

sen.j: 薩英戦争には、兄の喜左衛門が加わっているが、弟の繁は加わっていない。
sen.e: His older brother, Kizaemon joined the Anglo-Satsuma War but the younger brother, Shigeru did not.
His older brother, Kizaemon joined the Anglo-Satsuma War but the younger brother, Shigeru did not.
His older brother, Kizaemon joined the Anglo-Satsuma War but the younger brother, Shigeru did not.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）2月、戊辰戦争より帰国した下級藩士たちより起った藩政改革のため、側役まで出世した藩政から退けられる。
sen.e: Although he was promoted to Sobayaku (Secretary), he was removed from the administration of the domain on February, 1869 due to the domain administration reform initiated by lower ranked feudal retainers who came back from the Boshin War.

Although he was promoted to Sobayaku (Secretary), he was removed from the administration of the domain on February, 1869 due to the domain administration reform initiated by lower ranked feudal retainers who came back from the Boshin War.

Although he was promoted to Sobayaku (Secretary), he was removed from the administration of the domain on February, 1869 due to the domain administration reform initiated by lower ranked feudal retainers who came back from the Boshin War.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）12月、沖縄特使として鹿児島県へ出仕。
sen.e: On December, 1871, he served in Kagoshima Prefecture as a special envoy to Okinawa.
In December, 1871, he served in Kagoshima Prefecture as a special envoy to Okinawa.
sen.cmt: In December に訂正しました。
sen.e: In December, 1871, he served in Kagoshima Prefecture as a special envoy to Okinawa.

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）2月、島津氏（本家）家令となる。
sen.e: In February, 1874, he became a butler for (the head family of) the Shimazu clan.
In February, 1874, he became a butler for (the head family of) the Shimazu clan.
In February, 1874, he became a butler for (the head family of) the Shimazu clan.

sen.j: 明治9年（1876年）9月、玉里島津家の家令も兼ねる。
sen.e: In September, 1876, he served concurrently as a butler for the Tamazato-shimazu family.
In September, 1876, he served concurrently as a butler for the Tamazato-shimazu family.
In September, 1876, he served concurrently as a butler for the Tamazato-shimazu family.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）に内務権大書記官、明治14年（1881年）に農商務権大書記官、明治16年（1883年）に静岡県令。
sen.e: He served as the Provisional Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs in 1879, the Provisional Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce in 1881 and the Shizuoka prefectural governor in 1883.

He served as the Provisional Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs in 1879, the Provisional Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce in 1881 and the Shizuoka prefectural governor in 1883.

He served as the Provisional Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs in 1879, the Provisional Grand Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce in 1881 and the Shizuoka prefectural governor in 1883.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）には日本鉄道社長に就任した。
sen.e: He became the president of Nippon Railway in 1884.
He became the president of Nippon Railway in 1884.
He became the president of Nippon Railway in 1884.

sen.j: 明治25年（1892年）に沖縄県知事に就任するが、謝花昇らと対立を深め、謝花の組織した沖縄倶楽部への弾圧を行うなどの強権を以て県政に臨んだ。
sen.e: He became the governor of Okinawa Prefecture in 1892 and invoked the state power to conduct the prefectural administration such as oppressing Okinawa Club organized by Noboru JAHANA whom Shigeru conflicted with.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処謝花昇<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E8%AC%9D%E8%8A%B1%E6%98%87>「沖縄倶楽部」は直訳です
sen.e: He became the governor of Okinawa Prefecture in 1892 and invoked the state power to conduct the prefectural administration such as oppressing Okinawa Club organized by Noboru JAHANA whom Shigeru conflicted with.

He became the governor of Okinawa Prefecture in 1892 and invoked the state power to conduct the prefectural administration such as oppressing Okinawa Club organized by Noboru JAHANA whom Shigeru conflicted with.

sen.j: また官選知事としては異例の16年にわたって在任し「琉球王」の異名をとった。
sen.e: In addition, he held the office as a government-appointed governor for the unusual period of 16 years and was called "Ryukyuo (King of Ryukyu)".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「琉球王」は直訳です
sen.e: In addition, he held the office as a government-appointed governor for the unusual period of 16 years and was called "Ryukyuo (King of Ryukyu)".
In addition, he held the office as a government-appointed governor for the unusual period of 16 years and was called "Ryukyuo (King of Ryukyu)".

sen.j: 沖縄土地整理法の成立に伴い、県内の土地整理事業に尽力。
sen.e: He made efforts in the land consolidation project in Okinawa when the Okinawa land consolidation act was enacted.
sen.cmt: 「沖縄土地整理法」「土地整理事業」は直訳です
sen.e: He made efforts in the land consolidation project in Okinawa when the Okinawa land consolidation act was enacted.
He made efforts in the land consolidation project in Okinawa when the Okinawa land consolidation act was enacted.

sen.j: 沖縄県私立教育会総裁なども務めた。
sen.e: He served as the president of Okinawa Private Educational Association as well.
sen.cmt: 「私立教育会」は<http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110004782353>を参考に英訳しました。
sen.e: He served as the president of Okinawa Private Educational Association as well.
He served as the president of Okinawa Private Educational Association as well.

sen.j: 大久保利通と親交が深く、大久保が紀尾井坂の変で島田一郎に暗殺されたのち、明治21年5月、西村捨三らとともに、紀尾井坂に「贈右大臣大久保公哀悼碑」を建立した。
sen.e: He deepened a friendship with Toshimichi OKUBO and erected the "monument to express condolences to Okubo, Udaijin (the Minister of the Right)" in Kioizaka with Sutezo NISHIMURA in May, 1888 after Okubo was assassinated by Ichiro SHIMADA in the Kioizaka Incident

He deepened a friendship with Toshimichi OKUBO and erected the 'monument to express condolences to Okubo, Udaijin (the Minister of the Right)' in Kioizaka with Sutezo NISHIMURA in May, 1888 after Okubo was assassinated by Ichiro SHIMADA in the Kioizaka Incident

He deepened a friendship with Toshimichi OKUBO and erected the 'monument to express condolences to Okubo, Udaijin (the Minister of the Right)' in Kioizaka with Sutezo NISHIMURA in May, 1888 after Okubo was assassinated by Ichiro SHIMADA in the Kioizaka Incident

sen.j: のちに鳥羽伏見の戦いや西南戦争で大活躍する野津鎮雄、野津道貫兄弟の剣術師範であり、一時期は内弟子として二人を自宅に住まわせていた。
sen.e: He was a grand master of swordplay for the Shizuo and Michitsura NOZU brothers who played active roles in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi and the Seinan War, and made them stay in his home temporarily as private pupils.

He was a grand master of swordplay for the Shizuo and Michitsura NOZU brothers who played active roles in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi and the Seinan War, and made them stay in his home temporarily as private pupils.

He was a grand master of swordplay for the Shizuo and Michitsura NOZU brothers who played active roles in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi and the Seinan War, and made them stay in his home temporarily as private pupils.

sen.j: たびたび「あの兄弟は将器だ」と公言しており、実際に鎮雄は陸軍中将、道貫は陸軍大将となった。
sen.e: He often publicly stated that the brothers had the makings of a general, and actually Shizuo and Michitsura became the lieutenant general and the General of the Army, respectively.
He often publicly stated that the brothers had the makings of a general, and actually Shizuo and Michitsura became the lieutenant general and the General of the Army, respectively.
He often publicly stated that the brothers had the makings of a general, and actually Shizuo and Michitsura became the lieutenant general and the General of the Army, respectively.

sen.j: 繁の継嗣（戸籍変更後は次男）である奈良原三次は、明治44年（1911年）5月、自ら設計し、造った奈良原式二号複葉機で、150mほど飛ぶ。
sen.e: Shigeru's heir (the second son after the change to the family register), Sanji NARAHARA flied at about 150 meters in the Nanahara second biplane which was designed by him in May, 1911.
sen.cmt: 奈良原三次<http://www.saitama-subaru.co.jp/plane/02_narahara.html>「奈良原式二号複葉機」は直訳です
sen.e: Shigeru's heir (the second son after the change to the family register), Sanji NARAHARA flew about 150 meters in the Narahara second biplane which was designed by him in May, 1911.
sen.cmt: Nanahara ⇒ Narahara に訂正しました。Flied at ⇒ flew に訂正しました。
sen.e: Shigeru's heir (the second son after the change to the family register), Sanji NARAHARA flew about 150 meters in the Narahara second biplane which was designed by him in May, 1911.

sen.j: これが国産で最初の飛行とされている。
sen.e: This was the first fly of the domestic plane.
This was the first fly of the domestic plane.
This was the first fly of the domestic plane.

sen.j: なお昭和6年（1931年）、三次は日本軽飛行機倶楽部会長に推される。
sen.e: He was recommended to be the chairman of the Japan lightplane club in 1931.
sen.cmt: 「日本軽飛行機倶楽部」は直訳です
sen.e: He was recommended to be the chairman of the Japan lightplane club in 1931.
He was recommended to be the chairman of the Japan lightplane club in 1931.

sen.j: 薩摩藩士の奈良原喜左衛門は兄で、父はお由羅騒動で謹慎処分に遭う。
sen.e: A feudal retainer of Satsuma Province, Kizaemon NARAHARA was his older brother and his father was confined to his house for the Oyura-sodo (family feud over Narioki SHIMAZU's heir).
A feudal retainer of Satsuma Province, Kizaemon NARAHARA was his older brother and his father was confined to his house for the Oyura-sodo (family feud over Narioki SHIMAZU's heir).
A feudal retainer of Satsuma Province, Kizaemon NARAHARA was his older brother and his father was confined to his house for the Oyura-sodo (family feud over Narioki SHIMAZU's heir).

sen.j: 尖閣諸島の魚釣島の最高峰に、「奈良原岳」という命名がされたことがある。
sen.e: The highest summit of Uotsurijima-Island in the Senkaku islands had been given the name of "Narahara dake".
The highest summit of Uotsurijima-Island in the Senkaku islands had been given the name of "Narahara dake".
The highest summit of Uotsurijima-Island in the Senkaku islands had been given the name of "Narahara dake".

sen.j: 生麦事件の起きた文久2年（1862年）5月23日以来、京都薩摩藩邸に匿われていた吉田東洋暗殺犯の一人である那須信吾がその年の10月7日付で義父と兄に宛てた書簡の中に、生麦事件で英国人に斬りつけたのは、喜左衛門の弟である幸五郎（繁）だと書いている。
sen.e: Shingo NASU, one of the assassin of Toyo YOSHIDA, who was hidden in the residence of Satsuma Province since May 23, 1862 when the Namamugi Incident occurred, wrote a letter as of October 7 of the year to his father-in-law and older brother, saying that it was the Kizaemon's younger brother Yukigoro (Shigeru) who slashed the English man in the Namanugi Incident.

Shingo NASU, one of the assassin of Toyo YOSHIDA, who was hidden in the residence of Satsuma Province since May 23, 1862 when the Namamugi Incident occurred, wrote a letter of October 7 of the year to his father-in-law and older brother, saying that it was the Kizaemon's younger brother Yukigoro (Shigeru) who slashed the English man in the Namanugi Incident.
sen.cmt: as of ⇒ of に訂正しました。
sen.e: Shingo NASU, one of the assassin of Toyo YOSHIDA, who was hidden in the residence of Satsuma Province since May 23, 1862 when the Namamugi Incident occurred, wrote a letter of October 7 of the year to his father-in-law and older brother, saying that it was the Kizaemon's younger brother Yukigoro (Shigeru) who slashed the English man in the Namanugi Incident.

sen.j: なお那須信吾は、翌年の8月、奈良の代官所を襲撃した天誅組の変で戦死している。
sen.e: Shingo NASU died in the Tenchu-gumi incident where he attacked the magistrate office in Nara in August of the following year.
Shingo NASU died in the Tenchu-gumi incident where he attacked the magistrate office in Nara in August of the following year.
Shingo NASU died in the Tenchu-gumi incident where he attacked the magistrate office in Nara in August of the following year.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）12月、土佐藩参政・吉田東洋暗殺犯の一人である大石団蔵こと高見弥市を京都から鹿児島へ連れて帰る。
sen.e: In December, 1863, Shigeru took Yaichi TAKAMI known as Danzo OISHI, one of assassin of Toyo YOSHIDA and a councilor of Tosa Province, to Kagoshima.
In December, 1863, Shigeru took Yaichi TAKAMI known as Danzo OISHI, one of assassin of Toyo YOSHIDA and a councilor of Tosa Province, to Kagoshima.
In December, 1863, Shigeru took Yaichi TAKAMI known as Danzo OISHI, one of assassin of Toyo YOSHIDA and a councilor of Tosa Province, to Kagoshima.

sen.j: 高見は、その月に薩摩藩士（御小姓与）として取立てられ、3年後の慶応2年（1866年）3月、19人の英国留学生の一人に選ばれ、英国へ渡っている。
sen.e: Takami was received as a feudal retainer of Satsuma Province (with Okoshogumi family rank), and left for England three years later in March, 1866, being selected as one of 19 students studying England.

Takami was received as a feudal retainer of Satsuma Province (with Okoshogumi family rank), and left for England three years later in March, 1866, being selected as one of 19 students studying in England.
sen.cmt: in England に訂正しました。
sen.e: Takami was received as a feudal retainer of Satsuma Province (with Okoshogumi family rank), and left for England three years later in March, 1866, being selected as one of 19 students studying in England.
